column5: WILLISTON  N.D. North Dakota's oil regulator on Wednesday identified Lime Rock Resources as the buyer of Occidental Petroleum Corp's  North Dakota oil operations  confirming what Oxy's executives had yet to disclose publicly.

column4: N.Dakota confirms Lime Rock as buyer of Occidental's Bakken acreage
column5: WILLISTON  N.D.  Dec 9 North Dakota's oil regulator on Wednesday identified Lime Rock Resources as the buyer of Occidental Petroleum Corp's North Dakota oil operations  confirming what Oxy's executives had yet to disclose publicly.

column4: UPDATE 1-France eases telecom merger stance as Bouygues back in play
column5: PARIS  Dec 10 France's Economy Minister said he did not oppose in principle a consolidation of the country's telecoms sector to three operators from four  as state-controlled telecoms group Orange started talks about possibly buying a stake in Bouygues Telecom.

column4: Exclusive: PetroChina plans big gas grid stake sale under reform push - sources
column5: BEIJING/HONG KONG PetroChina is discussing selling a stake in domestic gas pipelines worth an estimated $47 billion in total  sources told Reuters  in a move seen as a prelude to Beijing's plans to break the state giant's near monopoly and boost spending on energy infrastructure.

column4: Petrobras CEO expects to sell $20 billion in debt in 2016: Bloomberg
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO Brazil's Petroleo Brasileiro SA  plans to sell about $20 billion of debt next year to finance its 2017 needs  Aldemir Bendine  chief executive of the state-run oil company known as Petrobras  told Bloomberg News on Thursday.

column4: Brazil's speaker plays for time to dodge corruption probe
column5: BRASILIA  Dec 10 Brazilian lawmakers almost came to blows on Thursday in a heated committee hearing that failed for a sixth time to decide whether to investigate lower house speaker Eduardo Cunha for lying about his bank accounts in Switzerland.

column4: Brazil's ANP asks govt. to extend Petrobras' Marlim field rights
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Dec 10 Brazil's oil industry regulator ANP on Thursday asked the government to extend the concession to operate the giant Marlim offshore oil field of state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA that is scheduled to expire in 2025.

column4: Brazil's top court suspends impeachment of Rousseff
column5: BRASILIA Brazil's Supreme Court suspended impeachment proceedings against President Dilma Rousseff until it rules on the validity of a secret ballot that stacked a congressional committee with opponents seeking to oust the leftist leader.

column4: UPDATE 3-Brazil's top court suspends impeachment of Rousseff
column5: BRASILIA  Dec 9 Brazil's Supreme Court suspended impeachment proceedings against President Dilma Rousseff until it rules on the validity of a secret ballot that stacked a congressional committee with opponents seeking to oust the leftist leader.

column4: Prudential sees 2016 EPS largely below estimates; plans $1.5 billion buyback
column5: Life insurer Prudential Financial Inc  forecast 2016 earnings per share largely below analysts' estimates  and authorized a $1.5 billion share buyback program.

column4: Fitch Affirms Prudential Plc's IDR at 'A+'; Outlook Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) LONDON/CHICAGO  December 10 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed Prudential Plc's  (Prudential) Long-term Issuer Default Rating (IDR) at 'A+' and senior unsecured  debt at 'A'. The agency has also affirmed Prudential Assurance Company Ltd's  (PAC) Insurer Financial Strength (IFS) rating at 'AA'.  At the same time  Fitch has affirmed Prudential's US subsidiaries Jackson  National Life Insurance Company and Jackson National Life Insurance C

column4: U.S. Missile Defense Agency tests Lockheed  Raytheon interceptors
column5: The U.S. Missile Defense Agency said it successfully completed the first intercept test for Lockheed Martin Corp's land-based Aegis missile-defense system  which is due to be deployed in Romania.

column4: UPDATE 1-U.S. Missile Defense Agency tests Lockheed  Raytheon interceptors
column5: Dec 10 The U.S. Missile Defense Agency said it successfully completed the first intercept test for Lockheed Martin Corp's land-based Aegis missile-defense system  which is due to be deployed in Romania.

column4: US Defense Agency tests Lockheed  Raytheon interceptors
column5: Dec 10 The U.S. Defense Agency said it successfully completed the first intercept test for Lockheed Martin Corp's land-based Aegis weapon system and Raytheon Co's Standard Missile-3 Block IB missile.

column4: Exclusive: U.S. Air Force to work on alternative GPS ground system
column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. Air Force will continue work on an alternative ground control program and explore outside options to hedge against further cost spikes and delays on Raytheon Co's  troubled ground control system for next-generation GPS satellites  according to an Air Force document seen by Reuters.

column4: MOVES-RBS' Skeet put at risk
column5: LONDON  Dec 10 (IFR) - Tim Skeet  a managing director in Royal Bank of Scotland's debt capital markets fixed income team  has been put at risk  according to a market source.

column4: BRIEF-Bauer Group seals joint venture with Schlumberger
column5: * Bauer Group seals joint venture in oil and gas drilling business with Schlumberger

column4: Buffett reports 8.02 percent stake in Sears' REIT Seritage Growth
column5: Billionaire investor Warren Buffett disclosed an 8.02 percent stake in Seritage Growth Properties   a real estate trust created by retailer Sears Holdings Corp .

column4: UPDATE 1-Buffett reports 8.02 pct stake in Sears' REIT Seritage Growth
column5: Dec 10 Billionaire investor Warren Buffett disclosed an 8.02 percent stake in Seritage Growth Properties   a real estate trust created by retailer Sears Holdings Corp.

column4: Warren Buffett reports 8.02 pct stake in Seritage Growth
column5: Dec 10 Billionaire investor Warren Buffett disclosed an 8.02 percent stake in real estate company Seritage Growth Properties.

column4: UPDATE 1-Southwest Airlines saw "unusual" discounting by rivals in November - CEO
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 10 Southwest Airlines Co  saw a lot of "unusual" discounting by larger U.S. rivals after bookings were lower than expected for last-minute travel around Thanksgiving  Chief Executive Gary Kelly told reporters in New York Thursday.

column4: Southwest Airlines saw 'unusual' discounting by rivals in November: CEO
column5: NEW YORK Southwest Airlines Co  saw a lot of "unusual" discounting by larger U.S. rivals after bookings were lower than expected for last-minute travel around Thanksgiving  Chief Executive Gary Kelly told reporters in New York Thursday.

column4: Southwest Airlines saw "unusual" discounting by rivals in Nov. - CEO
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 10 Southwest Airlines Co  saw a lot of "unusual" discounting by larger U.S. rivals after bookings were lower than expected for last-minute travel around Thanksgiving  Chief Executive Gary Kelly told reporters in New York Thursday.

column5: * Says orders machinery equipment worth T$3.8 billion  ($115.96 million) from Jer Yih Electrical Co Ltd  SPTS Technologies Ltd  Disco Corp and Teradyne Asia Pte. Ltd

column4: BRIEF-TSMC November sales T$63.43 bln  down 12.2 pct y/y  -22.4 pct m/m
column5: * Says November sales T$63.43 billion (Oct T$81.74 billion  Nov 2014 T$72.28 billion)

column4: SPECIAL REPORT-Buybacks enrich the bosses even when business sags
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 10When health insurer Humana Inc reported worse-than-expected quarterly earnings in late 2014 - including a 21 percent drop in net income - it softened the blow by immediately telling investors it would make a $500 million share repurchase.

column4: Deals of the day- Mergers and acquisitions
column5: Dec 10 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 1500 GMT on Thursday:

column4: French and Benelux stocks-Factors to watch on Dec 10
column5: PARIS  Dec 9 Below are company-related news and stories from French and Benelux media which could have an impact on the region's markets or individual stocks.

column4: Twitter looks to make money from ads aimed at logged-out users
column5: Twitter Inc said it was testing a feature to show advertisements to people who read tweets without logging in  as it tries to make good on its long-time ambition to monetize non-active users.

column4: UPDATE 2-Twitter looks to make money from ads aimed at logged-out users
column5: * Shares rise as much as 7.8 pct   (Adds background  updates share movement)

column4: Twitter targets ads at logged-out users
column5: Dec 10 Twitter Inc said it was testing a feature to show advertising to people who checked Twitter without logging in  to cash in on an additional half a billion people each month.

column4: U.S. seeks N.Y. lawyer's conviction over Maxim magazine deal fraud
column5: NEW YORK A New York lawyer "lied over and over" to lenders and others to help a felon fraudulently raise money to buy Maxim magazine  a federal prosecutor told jurors on Wednesday at the close of a trial.

column4: REFILE-U.S. seeks N.Y. lawyer's conviction over Maxim magazine deal fraud
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 9 A New York lawyer "lied over and over" to lenders and others to help a felon fraudulently raise money to buy Maxim magazine  a federal prosecutor told jurors on Wednesday at the close of a trial.

column4: Czech steel maker Moravia Steel eyes U.S. Steel's Slovak plant: paper
column5: BRATISLAVA Czech steelmaker Moravia Steel is eying the Slovak branch of United States Steel Corp  and the two sides have already had talks  newspaper Hospodarske Noviny reported on Thursday  citing unnamed sources.

column4: United Technologies unveils $1.5 billion restructuring plan to cut costs
column5: United Technologies Corp  raised the lower end of its full-year adjusted earnings forecast and announced a $1.5 billion restructuring plan aimed at reducing costs  mainly through factory consolidation.

column4: UPDATE 2-United Technologies unveils $1.5 bln restructuring plan to cut costs
column5: * Shares up 1.4 pct in extended trading   (Adds details  analysts estimates  background)

column4: BRIEF-Viktor Pichugov indirectly receives 10% stake in Bank Vozrozhdenie
column5: * Former senator of Khanty-Mansiysk Autonomous Okrug Viktor Pichugov indirectly received 10 pct stake in bank

column4: Wal-Mart says marketing head Stephen Quinn to retire in January
column5: Wal-Mart Stores Inc's  marketing head  Stephen Quinn  will retire in January  the company said in a statement on Thursday.

column4: UPDATE 3-Wal-Mart says marketing head Stephen Quinn to retire in January
column5: Dec 10 Wal-Mart Stores Inc's marketing head  Stephen Quinn  will retire in January  the company said in a statement on Thursday.

column4: Wal-Mart adds to mobile wallet frenzy with 'Walmart Pay'
column5: Wal-Mart Stores Inc  launched its own mobile payment service Walmart Pay on Thursday  potentially dealing a sharp blow to the ambitions of a mobile wallet the company had been co-developing with a consortium of retailers. | Video

column4: UPDATE 3-Wal-Mart adds to mobile wallet frenzy with 'Walmart Pay'
column5: * Wal-Mart does not support Apple Pay   (Adds company comments  analyst comment  details  background)

column4: Wal-Mart marketing head Stephen Quinn to retire-WSJ
column5: Dec 10 Wal-Mart Stores Inc's marketing head Stephen Quinn is expected to retire in January  the Wall Street Journal reported  citing people familiar with the situation.

column4: Wal-Mart enters mobile payment with launch of Walmart Pay
column5: Dec 10 Wal-Mart Stores Inc said it would launch 'Walmart Pay ' to become the first U.S. retailer to offer its own payment feature to expand consumer payment options and increase the speed of checkouts.

column4: Yum to return $6.2 billion to shareholders before China separation
column5: Yum Brands Inc  said it would return up to $6.2 billion to shareholders before separating its China business and listing it on the New York Stock Exchange  and possibly in Hong Kong.

column4: Yum China restaurant sales fall 3 pct in November
column5: Dec 10 Yum Brands Inc's same-restaurant sales in China fell about 3 percent in November.
